full_text: Screened by NARA, 6/2/2023 AUTIDAVIT OF SUPPORT Each applicant has to prove that he, as well as others in his family accompany inj hin, will not become public charges. The following items are acceptable proof. Income Tax returns accoupanied by W-2 forms are especially useful in proving employment and past earnings: 1. exployment: a. Proof of present employment: Submit an authenticated letter from an ployer giving details of salary, length of service, and nature OF duties, or b. JOD Offers: If applicant has never worked in U.S.A., offer of employment must also Le authenticated with details of salary, permanency of offer, and nature of duties. 2. PROOF OF PAST EARNINGS: Such evidence as latest income tax return and payslips for the last 5-G months that alien was in the U.S.A. 3. OTHER FINANCIAL ASSESS: Bank Statements, titles of houses, cars, stocks, bonds, business, etc. 4. AFFIDAVIT OF SUPPORT: Nature and data in such afficavits: Nature: 1. From close member of the family, such as uncle, aunt, brother, sister, mother, father, wife, husband. Affidavits from friends normally carry very little weight. Both husband and wife should sign when affiant is married. 2. Mfidavit should be less than one year old Data: 1. Relationship to the applicant 2. Employment salary, length of service, prospects for permanency 3. Other financial resources: houses, bank accounts, stocks, etc. 4. Latest income tax return files 5. Obligations and expenses: e.g. mortgages, loans, special medical care 6. Hambers of his own family and other persons dependent upon him for naintenance support. Include alimony and support of children from previous marriage (s) 7. The above must be supported by notarized documents from employer, bank, courts, or other pertinent sources. The Consular Officer evaluates the information in the above four categories as a whole in conjunction with other available data regarding the applicant. Thus, it is not possible to guarantee in advance that the evidence presental will be acceptable. The applicant, therefore, is advised to furnish as much of the above mentioned evidence as possible.
